body_html: @ChanZou I noticed my case is slightly different. The data I fed in feed_init_fn() is the training data thus I do not have the need to save them later. For your case, I suggest you use the init_fn parameter of slim.learning.train. That is, as @gauss-clb said, ensure that there are no checkpoint files in logdir, then set init_fn to be the returned value of tf.contrib.framework.assign_from_checkpoint_fn.
body_text: @ChanZou I noticed my case is slightly different. The data I fed in feed_init_fn() is the training data thus I do not have the need to save them later. For your case, I suggest you use the init_fn parameter of slim.learning.train. That is, as @gauss-clb said, ensure that there are no checkpoint files in logdir, then set init_fn to be the returned value of tf.contrib.framework.assign_from_checkpoint_fn.
body: @ChanZou I noticed my case is slightly different. The data I fed in feed_init_fn() is the training data thus I do not have the need to save them later. For your case, I suggest you use the init_fn parameter of slim.learning.train. That is, as @gauss-clb said, ensure that there are no checkpoint files in logdir, then set init_fn to be the returned value of tf.contrib.framework.assign_from_checkpoint_fn.
